Consider the modification of the initial temperature distribution by the function \\( g(u) = u + \\sin(\\omega x) \\), with \\(\\omega\\) being a constant frequency.

Given the final temperature distribution \\( u(T, x) \\), can one determine which modifications (\\( g(u) \\), \\( h(u) \\), or both) were applied during the evolution?
Explanation: After substantial time evolution under the diffusion process, distinguishing the effects of the sine and cosine modifications on the initial and intermediate states can be challenging. The overlapping influences of both functions make it impossible to identify with certainty which modifications were applied.
